subsubsection.title: Definitions
subsubsection.p:
Write a definition or description for each term:
Inverse function
Inverse function notation
Horizontal line test
One-to-one function
Symmetric about y=x

statement.p: Illustrate each term above for the following situation:
The sales tax T on an item that costs p dollars is given by the function T=f(p)=1.15p

ol.li: The inverse function gives the price p of an item whose sales tax is T dollars.
The graph of T=f(p)=1.15p is linear, and so passes the horizontal line test.
A function that passes the horizontal line test is one-to-one: for each value of p there is only one value of T, and vice versa.

subsection.title: 2. Solve an equation for a variable

introduction.p: When finding a formual for an inverse function, we need to solve for one variable in terms of the other.

statement.p: Solve ~y=\sqrt{x^3-4}~ for x in terms of y.
Solve ~y=\dfrac{x+1}{x-2}~ for x in terms of y.
Solve ~y=5-4\sqrt{x+2}~ for x in terms of y.
Solve ~y=\dfrac{3}{\sqrt[3]{x+6}}~ for x in terms of y.
Solve ~y=(2x-3)^3+1~ for x in terms of y.
Solve ~y=\dfrac{3x-1}{2x+1}~ for x in terms of y.

introduction.p: Keep in mind that the notation for an inverse function, f^{-1}(x), does not mean the reciprocal of the function. This is a different use of the notation from how it is used as an exponent.

statement.p:
f(x)=2x-3~. Find formulas for:
g(x)=\dfrac{1}{f(x)}
h(x)=-f(x)
j(x)=f^{-1}(x)

ol.label: a
ol.li: g(x) is the reciprocal of f(x): g(x)=\dfrac{1}{2x-3}
h(x) is the negative or opposite of f(x): h(x)=3-2x

ol.label: a

h(x) is the negative or opposite of f(x): ~h(x)=-\sqrt[3]{x-4}
